title: Firefox kullanırken gmail'e login olamıyorum.
content:
Merhaba, PC'de Firefox kullanırken gmail hesabıma giriş yapamıyorum."Google workspace" yazısı yükleme ekranında kalıyor ve hiçbirşekilde gmail hesabım ekrana gelmiyor.Mobilde sorun yok,pc'de diğer browserlarda sorun yok,sadece firefoxta bu sorunu yaşıyorum.

İnternette önerilen yöntem olarak, geçici internet dosyalarını ve çerezleri(cookie) temizledim. Gezinti geçmişini komple sildim.Firefox'u sıfırladım.Sorun devam edince firefox'u silip sıfırdan yükledim.

Bu sefer gmail hesabıma giriyorum ama maillerim açılmıyor.Sayfayı kapatır yada reload yaparsam gmail yüklenme ekranında kalma sorunu tekrar ediyor. Bu sorunla 1 haftadır boğuşuyorum ve yabancı forumlar dahil hiçbir çözüm bulamadım. Çözüm bulabilmiş arkadaşlardan yardım bekliyorum,teşekkürler.

Hello, I cannot log in to my gmail account while using Firefox on PC. The "Google workspace" text remains on the loading screen and my gmail account does not appear on the screen in any way. There is no problem on mobile, there is no problem on other browsers on PC, I only have this problem with Firefox.

As the method recommended on the internet, I cleared the temporary internet files and cookies. I completely deleted the browsing history. I reset Firefox. When the problem persisted, I deleted Firefox and reinstalled it from scratch.

This time I log in to my gmail account but my emails do not open. If I close the page or reload, the problem of staying on the gmail loading screen repeats. I have been struggling with this problem for 1 week and I have not found any solution, including foreign forums. I am waiting for help from friends who have found a solution, thank you.
creator: oevcimen

title: "Collections" on Firefox for Android: Developer Request
content:
I'm hoping a developer for Firefox sees this:

With as much technology existing today, I think it's a big miss that "Collections" aren't synced across devices. You spend a couple years setting up an amazing Collections resource, and then you get a new device and have no efficient way to retain those collections. The idea that I have to open every link, copy it, text it to myself, open it on the new device and save it into a Collection again -- for every single webpage I've saved for years -- is nauseating.

Is this something that developers could possibly work on improving? I'm not even interested in building Collections again, considering that they are just a temporary, device-specific feature. Why bother, if I'm just going to lose them every time I upgrade my device?
creator: savanna1980

title: Trouble viewing websites with Firefox
content:
I am having difficulty trying to view a website. I receive the following message whenever I try to view this website:

"Suspected Phishing This website has been reported for potential phishing.

Phishing is when a site attempts to steal sensitive information by falsely presenting as a safe source."


There are two buttons beneath this message, the one on the left which reads "Learn More," the one on the right which reads "Ignore & Proceed." Yet when I click on either of the buttons a blank white page appears.

The web address in the URL field also changes from the website I originally selected to the following:

https://www.smartredirect.de/redir/clickGate.php?u=IgKHHLBT&m=1&p=8vZ5ugFkSx&t=vHbSdnLT&st=&s=&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.brutaltops.com%2F&r=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3DBrutalTops.com%26sca_esv%3D9a8e8f6bd3ba345e%26source%3Dhp%26ei%3DHMO2Z6SJBaqWwbkP7JzXUA%26iflsig%3DACkRmUkAAAAAZ7bRLHc87-cSI48xaawgAj9EjL-Nm71U%26ved%3D0ahUKEwikh43Vx9GLAxUqSzABHWzOFQoQ4dUDCBM%26oq%3DBrutalTops.com%26gs_lp%3DEgdnd3Mtd2l6Ig5CcnV0YWxUb3BzLmNvbUjNa1CbCliBWXABeACQAQCYAW--QHCAgoQABiABBixAxgKwgINEAAYgAQYsQMYgwEYCsICBxAuGIAEGArCAgcQABiABBgKwgIFEAAY7wWYAxPxBQrZJeqRYy6tkgcDNi4zoAeUYg%26sclient%3Dgws-wiz



Why would I not be able to view this website (and others too) with Firefox but am able with Chrome? I want to be able use Firefox, as Chrome will not allow use of an extension that Firefox will. 

Please tell me how this problem may be fixed.

title: first of all, do no harm
content:
That is the first line in the Hippocratic Oath. All doctors have to swear to it. All software developers should too.

I made the mistake of letting Firefox on KUbuntu update. It obliterated all my tabs and all my history. There's nothing left. I had a lot of tabs open with intent to use them to update some astronomy instructional activities. I don't know if I'll be able to find them again.

I don't really have a question except to ask: What fresh hell is this? Is it really that hard to just leave things the hell alone? I'm afraid to ever update Firefox again. If everything else wasn't based on Chromium, I'd be out of here.

Also, it looks like something out of Windows 7.

It's all gone. It's a wonder you didn't delete all my bookmarks while you were at it.
creator: pjcamp

title: block pop-up ads
content:
Today, Stephen Weisman Esq., in his Scamicide daily post, wrote: While often the pop-up ads may be legitimate advertisements, in other cases they are created by scammers who lure you into clicking on links and being directed to websites that either convince you to provide personal information that can be used to make you a victim of identity theft or, in a worst case scenario, merely by either clicking on the link or being redirected to another website, you may unwittingly download malware such as ransomware or keystroke logging malware that can steal from your phone or computer sensitive personal information that can be used to access your bank account or make you a victim of identity theft in other ways.

He also wrote that pop-up ads can be blocked but I don't see that option on Firefox Mozilla. Please let me know how to do this.

Thank you.

title: Hardware acceleration dropping frames on videos with small viewport resolutions
content:
Hi!

I've noticed dropped frames in videos for a while now, but only recently tested the issue. Using youtubes stats for nerds, I found that when videos have a small viewport resolution, it starts to drop frames. (I would test with other sites but only know of youtubes stats for nerds system to detect issues like this) For example a viewport resolution of 1250x703 does not drop frames, however by unmaximising the screen and the viewport resolution drops to 681x383, it begins dropping frames.

Using my 2nd monitor which has a smaller actual resolution, the video drops frames unless fullscreened, see recordings below. Test A | Firefox Maximised but video not fullscreen Test B | Firefox Maximised and video fullscreen This issue also occurs with picture-in-picture mode.

Disabling hardware acceleration fixes this issue but for some reason only affects firefox, using MS Edge with "graphics acceleration" enabled does not result in this issue. Is this potentially an issue specifically with how firefox handles hardware acceleration? Also since I require hardware acceleration to be enabled for 3D model work in my browser, is there something I'm missing here that would allow me to keep hardware acceleration on but not have this issue?

Any help is much appreciated, thanks!
creator: nathantudor72

title: Is there a *hit-simple TBird yet?
content:
If I send mail to curly@stooges.com, it gets put in the curly@stooges.com mailbox -- created if it doesn't exist.

If I get an email from curly@stooges.com, it gets put in the curly@stooges.com mailbox -- created if it doesn't exist. If I reply, the reply gets put in the curly@stooges.com mailbox.

I have one and only one SMTP account. I have 1,000,001 POP accounts. Mailboxes and accounts have no relationship.

This is a serious question, not a joke.

Thanks -- Mark (frozen at version 102.7.1 until a *hit-simple TBird exists).
